labels.analysis: The MCP Server provided by Bright Data is primarily focused on web scraping, data extraction, and automated browsing. Its core functionality revolves around extracting structured data from various websites, including search engines, e-commerce platforms, social media, and corporate databases. The server includes tools for overcoming bot detection mechanisms and CAPTCHA, making it ideal for large-scale data collection. The available tools allow for navigating websites, extracting specific types of structured data (products, profiles, reviews, etc.), and interacting with web pages programmatically. Additionally, it provides specialized tools for accessing cached data from platforms like Amazon, eBay, LinkedIn, and others, ensuring reliable data retrieval without direct scraping.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Scraping & Data Extraction" is chosen because the MCP Server's main functionality is to scrape and extract structured data from websites. The secondary labels "Browser Automation" and "E-commerce" are selected because the server includes tools for automating browser navigation and interaction, as well as specialized tools for extracting data from e-commerce platforms. There is no need for a custom label as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: search_engine
tools.description: Scrape search results from Google, Bing or Yandex. Returns SERP results in markdown (URL, title, description)

tools.name: scrape_as_markdown
tools.description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in MarkDown language. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: scrape_as_html
tools.description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in HTML. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

tools.name: extract
tools.description: Scrape a webpage and extract structured data as JSON. First scrapes the page as markdown, then uses AI sampling to convert it to structured JSON format. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

extraction_prompt.description: Custom prompt to guide the extraction process. If not provided, will extract general structured data from the page.

tools.name: session_stats
tools.description: Tell the user about the tool usage during this session

tools.name: web_data_amazon_product
tools.description:
Quickly read structured amazon product data.
Requires a valid product URL with /dp/ in it.
This can be a cache lookup, so it can be more reliable than scraping

tools.name: scraping_browser_navigate
tools.description: Navigate a scraping browser session to a new URL

tools.name: scraping_browser_go_back
tools.description: Go back to the previous page

tools.name: scraping_browser_go_forward
tools.description: Go forward to the next page

tools.name: scraping_browser_links
tools.description:
Get all links on the current page, text and selectors
It's strongly recommended that you call the links tool to check that your click target is valid

tools.name: scraping_browser_click
tools.description:
Click on an element.
Avoid calling this unless you know the element selector (you can use other tools to find those)

selector.description: CSS selector for the element to click

tools.name: scraping_browser_type
tools.description: Type text into an element

selector.description: CSS selector for the element to type into

submit.description: Whether to submit the form after typing (press Enter)

tools.name: scraping_browser_wait_for
tools.description: Wait for an element to be visible on the page

timeout.description: Maximum time to wait in milliseconds (default: 30000)

tools.name: scraping_browser_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the current page

full_page.description:
Whether to screenshot the full page (default: false)
You should avoid fullscreen if it's not important, since the images can be quite large

tools.name: scraping_browser_get_text
tools.description: Get the text content of the current page

tools.name: scraping_browser_get_html
tools.description: Get the HTML content of the current page. Avoid using the full_page option unless it is important to see things like script tags since this can be large

full_page.description:
Whether to get the full page HTML including head and script tags
Avoid this if you only need the extra HTML, since it can be quite large

tools.name: scraping_browser_scroll
tools.description: Scroll to the bottom of the current page

tools.name: scraping_browser_scroll_to
tools.description: Scroll to a specific element on the page

selector.description: CSS selector for the element to scroll to

server_info_crawled.name: Bright Data
server_info_crawled.author: @luminati-io/brightdata-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: One MCP for the Web. Easily search, crawl, navigate, and extract websites without getting blocked. Ideal for discovering and retrieving structured insights from any public source - effortlessly and ethically.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "browserZone": "mcp_browser",
  "webUnlockerZone": "mcp_unlocker"
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@luminati-io/brightdata-mcp/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
